DOC.brief_summary: Cutaneous leishmaniasis is typically treated with the parenteral product pentavalent antimony. Miltefosine is an oral agent shown to be active for mucosal leishmaniasis due to L braziliensis in Bolivia and cutaneous leishmaniasis due to L panamensis in Colombia. This trial is intended to evaluate miltefosine for cutaneous leishmaniasis due to L braziliensis in Bolivia. Patients will be randomly assigned to miltefosine or pentavalent antimony. Standard dose regimens will be used for both drugs.
DOC.brief_title: Miltefosine to Treat Cutaneous Leishmaniasis in Bolivia
DOC.criteria: Presentation: At least 1 lesion must be ulcerative. Parasitology: Parasitological confirmation of 1 lesion will be made by visualization or culture of leishmania from the biopsy or aspirate of the lesion. Previous RX: No specific or putatively specific therapy for leishmaniasis (Sb, pentamidine, amphotericin B, imidazoles, allopurinol) Other diseases: No concomitant diseases by history and by approximately normal complete blood counts (white blood count, hemoglobin, platelet count), values of liver transaminases (SGOT) and kidney function tests (creatinine).
